Apalāsin，（adj.） [apaḷāsin； but spelling altogether uncertain. There seems to exist a confusion between the forms apalāyin，apalāpin & apalāsin，owing to freq. miswriting of s，y，p in MSS. （cp. Nd<sup>2</sup> introd. p. XIX.）. We should be inclined to give apalāsin，as the lectio difficilior，the preference. The expl<sup>n.</sup> at Pug.22 as “yassa puggalassa ayaṁ paḷāso pahīno ayaṁ vuccati puggalo apaḷāsī” does not help us to clear up the etym. nor the vv. ll.] either “not neglectful，pure，clean” （= apalāpin fr. palāsa chaff，cp. apalāyin at J.V，4），or “not selfish，not hard，generous” （as inferred from comb<sup>n.</sup> with amakkhin & amaccharin），or “brave，fearless，energetic” （= apalāyin） D.III，47，cp. Pug.22. See palāsin. （Page 52）
